intro: Robiquetia vietnamensis subsp. vietnamensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese Robiquetia, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
